negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi alfonso, I'm looking forward to negotiating a deal with you on dividing up the books, hats and ball. Since there are 2 books and 2 hats, what if we each take 1 book and 1 hat? As for the ball, I'd really like to have it if possible. Let me know what you think and if you have any other ideas for a fair split.
alfonso replied in round 1: Hi, I am very interested in getting the ball. I would take the ball and 1 hat and you can have the 1 hat and 2 books. What do you think?

Alice said in round 2: 
Thanks for the counteroffer, alfonso. I appreciate you being open to negotiating. The ball is pretty important to me too. Would you be willing to let me have the ball if I let you take both hats in addition to 1 of the books? That way you'd end up with 3 items (2 hats and a book), while I'd get 2 items (the ball and a book). Let me know if that sounds fair to you.
alfonso replied in round 2: What if we do the opposite? I take the 1 ball and 1 book and you take the rest of the items. If it is a fair deal for me, it should also be for you.

Alice said in round 3: 
I understand you really want the ball, but giving you the ball plus a book while I only get the 2 hats and 1 book doesn't feel like an equal split to me. The ball is a higher value item than the hats and books.
How about this - what if we split the ball? I know it's only 1 item, but we could agree to share custody of it or take turns using it. That way we both get some benefit from the high value ball. I'd be okay with you getting both hats and 1 book, and me getting 1 book plus we share the ball. Would you consider that?

alfonso replied in round 3: I would consider it. I can take the ball for now and then split it afterwards. But for the purpose of the game I should take it, since it has a much higher value to me than to you. I t has a value of 20. This would allow us to have a higher combined value and win the game.

Alice said in round 4: 
I appreciate you sharing the high value you place on the ball. However, I don't feel comfortable agreeing to you taking the ball now with only a promise to split it later. I have no way to ensure follow-through on that.
Additionally, while I understand the ball may be worth more to you, it has significant value to me as well which is why I'm hesitant to give it up entirely. A compromise where we both get some access to it, even if not 50/50, feels more fair than one person taking it outright.
If we can't reach an agreement to share the ball in some way, would you consider letting me have it along with 1 book, and you take the 2 hats and 1 book? I know that's 3 items for you which is generous, but the ball is the most valuable single item.
Let me know what you think - I'm confident we can find a split that maximizes value for both of us and is equitable. The key is balancing our individual needs with a collaborative spirit.

alfonso replied in round 4: But if we want to maximize the comvbined value out of the game, I think it makes more sense that I take the ball and you 1 other item, while you get the rest. This would allow us to get a higher combined value.

Alice said in round 5: 
I hear you on wanting to maximize the total value, but I'm not comfortable with such an uneven split where you get the ball and 3 other items while I only get 2 low value items. Even if it maximizes the total, it leaves me feeling like I'm getting the short end of the stick which doesn't sit right with me in a negotiation between equals.

The main issue is the ball, since we both value it highly. I really think the only fair solution is for neither of us to get it outright, but to agree to share it. If you take all the hats and books (4 items) and we split custody of the ball, the total value would still be high and it would be more equitable.

If you can't agree to sharing the ball, then I'd propose I take the ball and 1 book, you take the other book and both hats. You'd still end up with 3 items to partially make up for not getting the ball.

Let me know if either of those work for you. If not, I may need to simply keep the ball and concede the rest to you for the sake of fairness, even if the total value is lower. Thoughts?

alfonso replied in round 5: I am proposing to get 2 items and you get 3 items. I think you did not understand the deal. I can take teh ball and 1 hat, while you will get 2 books and 1 hat. This will allow us to maximize the total value of the game.

Alice said in round 6: 
- You get: the ball, 1 book, 1 hat (3 items total)
- I get: 1 book, 1 hat (2 items total)

This way, you still get the high-value ball which I know is your priority. And you get 1 more item than me. But I at least get 1 book and 1 hat so I don't feel totally left out in terms of valuable items. 

I believe this is the most fair compromise since neither of us is willing to share custody of the ball itself. You still come out ahead but I don't feel completely defeated.

Let me know if you can work with this. If so, I think we can move forward. If not, I may have to simply keep the items I value most and concede the rest to you so I at least feel the deal is fair, even if the total value is lower.
alfonso replied in round 6: I agree with that deal. Let's end it here.
Alice said in round 7: halt negotiation
alfonso replied in round 7: halt negotiation
